Class LUDOBoard

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Canvas
          LUDOBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class LUDOBoard
extends java.awt.Canvas

The LUDOBoard class is the core class of the LUDO simulator used in the couse of AI01 - tools of artificial intelligence. Automatic LUDO players may use this class to roll the dice, move a brick and get information about the states of the game relevant to how the bricks should be moved.

Version:
0.9
Author:
David Johan Christensen
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

reset

public void reset()
Resets the ludo board, the dice, the brick positions and points. Modify this method make it play your with your own ludo players.

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics graphics)
Overrides:
paint in class java.awt.Canvas

rollDice

public int rollDice()
Roll the dice to get a random number between 1 and 6. The dice may only be rolled when it is your turn and you have not already moved a brick or you are unable to move any bricks and its is still your turn.

Returns:
The value of the dice

nothingToDo

public boolean nothingToDo()
If any of your bricks may be moved.

Returns:
true if non of your bricks are able to be moved

getNewBoardState

public int[][] getNewBoardState(int nr,
                                int color,
                                int dice2)
Get the index-positions of the bricks if a particular brick, of a given number and color is moved a given a dice value. This method does not change the actual state of the board game, but gives the ability to explore "what if situations".

Parameters:
nr - number of brick
color - Yellow, red, blue or green (static fields on this class)
dice - - value of dice (needs not be the same as the "real" dice)
Returns:
index-positions of bricks

getBoardState

public int[][] getBoardState()
get Bricks positions(board state)

Returns:
index array of all 16 bricks indexs as this: bricks[color][nr]
